verses.kjv: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
verses.ct: It's better to be poor and live with integrity than to be a fool who speaks dishonestly.

verses.kjv: Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
verses.ct: Enthusiasm without knowledge is not good, and whoever rushes ahead will stumble into mistakes.

verses.kjv: The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the LORD.
verses.ct: A person's own foolishness ruins their life, and then their heart resents the LORD for it.

verses.kjv: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
verses.ct: Wealth attracts plenty of friends, but poverty drives people away.

verses.kjv: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.
verses.ct: A lying witness will not go unpunished, and anyone who tells lies will not get away with it.

verses.kjv: Many will intreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.
verses.ct: Many people seek the approval of influential leaders, and everyone wants to be friends with a generous person.

verses.kjv: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.
verses.ct: Even the brothers of a poor person avoid him — how much more will his friends distance themselves! He chases after them with pleas, but they are nowhere to be found.

verses.kjv: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
verses.ct: Whoever gains wisdom does themselves a great favor; whoever holds on to understanding will discover what is good.

verses.kjv: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.
verses.ct: A lying witness will not go unpunished, and anyone who tells lies will be destroyed.

verses.kjv: Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
verses.ct: Luxury is not fitting for a fool, and it's even less appropriate for a servant to rule over leaders.

verses.kjv: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
verses.ct: Good sense makes a person slow to anger, and it brings them honor to overlook an offense.

verses.kjv: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
verses.ct: A king's anger is like the roar of a lion, but his approval is like dew falling on the grass.

verses.kjv: A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
verses.ct: A foolish son is a disaster for his father, and a quarrelsome wife is like a constantly dripping faucet.

verses.kjv: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.
verses.ct: A house and wealth can be inherited from parents, but a wise wife is a gift from the LORD.

verses.kjv: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
verses.ct: Laziness puts a person into a deep sleep, and an idle soul will go hungry.

verses.kjv: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.
verses.ct: Whoever obeys God's commands protects their own soul, but whoever is careless about how they live will die.

verses.kjv: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.
verses.ct: Whoever shows generosity to the poor is lending to the LORD, and the LORD will repay them for what they've given.

verses.kjv: Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
verses.ct: Discipline your son while there is still time, but don't let yourself be swayed by his crying.

verses.kjv: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
verses.ct: A hot-tempered person will face the consequences, because even if you rescue them, you'll just have to do it again.

verses.kjv: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
verses.ct: Listen to advice and accept correction so that you will be wise for the rest of your life.

verses.kjv: There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.
verses.ct: People make many plans in their hearts, but it is the LORD's purpose that will ultimately prevail.

verses.kjv: The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.
verses.ct: What makes a person attractive is their loyalty, and it's better to be poor than to be a liar.

verses.kjv: The fear of the LORD tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
verses.ct: Wholehearted dedication to the LORD leads to life — whoever has it will rest content, untouched by harm.

verses.kjv: A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
verses.ct: A lazy person buries their hand in the dish but can't even be bothered to lift it back to their mouth.

verses.kjv: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
verses.ct: Punish a mocker, and an inexperienced person will learn caution; correct someone with understanding, and they will gain knowledge.

verses.kjv: He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.
verses.ct: A son who mistreats his father and drives away his mother brings shame and disgrace.

verses.kjv: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.
verses.ct: My son, if you stop listening to instruction, you will wander away from the words of knowledge.

verses.kjv: An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
verses.ct: A corrupt witness makes a mockery of justice, and the mouth of the wicked swallows up sin eagerly.

verses.kjv: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
verses.ct: Punishment is ready for mockers, and beatings are prepared for the backs of fools.
